pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

“The wise learn many things from their enemies.” —
Aristophanes

pastInspirations.q: Anyone who reads a book with a sense of obligation does not understand the art of reading.
pastInspirations.h:
“Anyone who reads a book with a sense of obligation does not understand the art of reading.” —

pastInspirations.q: Your business is not to 'get somewhere' - it is to be here.
pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.q: Words are the clothing of our thoughts.

pastInspirations.q: Perseverance and spirit have done wonders in all ages.
pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.q: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.q: The positive thinker sees the invisible, feels the intangible, and achieves the impossible.

pastInspirations.q: Character is doing what you don't want to do but know you should do.
pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.q: Without the confidence, nothing can be accomplished.

pastInspirations.q: Numbing the pain for a while will make it worse when you finally feel it.
pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

Alfred Adler

pastInspirations.q: You are your best thing.

Toni Morrison

pastInspirations.q: Live your life and forget your age.

pastInspirations.h:

Gilbert Chesterton

Zhuangzi

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

Jon Kabat-Zinn

pastInspirations.q: A golden cage is still just a cage.

“A golden cage is still just a cage.” —
Anita Krizzan

pastInspirations.q: It's your outlook on life that counts.
pastInspirations.h:
“It's your outlook on life that counts.” —
Betty White

pastInspirations.q: Zen insists that the whole trouble is just our failure to realize that there is no problem.
pastInspirations.h:
“Zen insists that the whole trouble is just our failure to realize that there is no problem.” —
Bruce Lee

pastInspirations.q: It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing.
pastInspirations.h:
“It is not the knowing that is difficult, but the doing. ” —
Chinese Proverb

pastInspirations.q: Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.
pastInspirations.h:
“Sometimes you have to lose all you have to find out who you truly are.” —
Roy T. Bennett

pastInspirations.q: You are your best thing.
pastInspirations.h:
“You are your best thing.” —
Toni Morrison

pastInspirations.q: If you want to turn a vision into reality, you have to give 100% and never stop believing in your dream.
pastInspirations.h:

Arnold Schwarzenegger

Conrad Hilton

Naval Ravikant

pastInspirations.q: Teachers open the door. You enter by yourself.

Chinese Proverb

pastInspirations.q: Every second you have on this planet is very precious and it's your responsibility that you're happy.
pastInspirations.h:

Arnold Schwarzenegger

pastInspirations.q: If you focus on success, you'll have stress. But if you pursue excellence, success will be guaranteed.

Deepak Chopra

pastInspirations.q: Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.
pastInspirations.h:
“Weeds are flowers too, once you get to know them.” —
A.A. Milne

pastInspirations.q: Courage is fear that has said its prayers and decided to go forward anyway.
pastInspirations.h:

Joyce Meyer

pastInspirations.q: Some people feel the rain. Others just get wet.
pastInspirations.h:
“Some people feel the rain. Others just get wet. ” —
Bob Dylan

pastInspirations.q: Common sense is not so common.

“Common sense is not so common. ” —
Voltaire

pastInspirations.q: The saddest aspect of life is that there is no one on earth whose happiness is such that he won't sometimes wish he were dead rather than alive.
pastInspirations.h:

Herodotus

pastInspirations.q: If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.
pastInspirations.h:
“If you try to micromanage yourself all you're going to do is make yourself miserable.” —
Naval Ravikant

pastInspirations.q: Never be bored, and you will never be boring.
pastInspirations.h:
“Never be bored, and you will never be boring.” —
Eleanor Roosevelt

pastInspirations.q: It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one.

“It is better to offer no excuse than a bad one. ” —
George Washington

pastInspirations.q: Being in a good frame of mind helps keep one in the picture of health.
pastInspirations.h:
“Being in a good frame of mind helps keep one in the picture of health.” —
Unknown

pastInspirations.q: Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.

“Success is like reaching an important birthday and finding you're exactly the same.” —
Audrey Hepburn

pastInspirations.q: The more we value things, the less we value ourselves.

pastInspirations.q: No one can compete with you on being you. Most of life is a search for who and what needs you the most.

Naval Ravikant

Socrates

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.q: Great thoughts speak only to the thoughtful mind, but great actions speak to all mankind.

pastInspirations.q: Confidence is consistency of thinking about what is possible and how to make it possible.
pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.q: Turn off your mind, relax, and float downstream.
pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.q: It only takes a split second to smile and forget, yet to someone that needed it, it can last a lifetime.
pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.h:

pastInspirations.q: A man who dares to waste one hour of time has not discovered the value of life.

pastInspirations.q: Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance.
pastInspirations.h:
“Anger begins with folly, and ends with repentance. ” —
Beverly Sills

pastInspirations.h:

Unknown

pastInspirations.q: Begin now to be what you will be hereafter.
pastInspirations.h:
“Begin now to be what you will be hereafter.” —
St. Jerome

pastInspirations.q: People seldom do what they believe in. They do what is convenient, then repent.

inspirationOfDay.q: Intelligent men are cruel. Stupid men are monstrously cruel.
inspirationOfDay.h:
“Intelligent men are cruel. Stupid men are monstrously cruel.” —
Jack London
